identificationModule.briefTitle: the Effect of the CALIGALOC Orthosis on Standing and Walking of Hemiparetic Patients With Ankle Varus
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of the Effect of the CALIGALOC Orthosis on Standing and Walking of Hemiparetic Patients With Ankle Varus

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the benefit of an anti-varus ankle foot orthosis (CALIGALOC, Bauerfeind) on gait and balance parameters in hemiparetic patients.

interventions.name: Caligaloc
interventions.description: 15 days of wearing of the Caligaloc orthosis

primaryOutcomes.description: Maximum gait velocity, from a standing start

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of gait temporospatial parameters by GaitRite®
secondaryOutcomes.description: Specific temporal and spatial parameters of gait will be measured with the GaitRite gait evaluation system: gait cadence, hemiparetic step length, spatial asymmetry, swing and stance times.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Posturographic analysis during static upright stance (center of pressure surface)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessment of displacements of the center of pressure during quiet upright standing for 30s, using a Zebris platform
Assessment of the paretic footprint during gait, using the Zebris platform
Assessment of maximum gait perimeter during a 2mwt
Lower Limb Function assessment scale (LL-FAS, Allart et al. 2015) functional subscores

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Tolerability of the wearing of the Caligaloc orthosis assessed by visual analog scale

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Hemiparesis at \> 3 months (whatever the etiology)
* varus or equinovarus foot disturbing the stance phase of gait
* Able to walk at least 10m, with or without assistive device

Exclusion Criteria:

* unable to walk 10m
* Botulinum toxin injection less than 3 months before inclusion
* history of neurological or locomotor pathology in addition to the etiology of hemiparesis
* Severe comprehension troubles
* Pregnancy
